title: With TalkTalk? Cyber attack ...
text: [news] 00:21 Talk Talk have spent enough money on base station masts for hundreds of UK customers to use their smartphones, often at the same time. After that and the advertising budget, it's obvious there's only going to be enough cash for the traditional network perimeter defenses of Firewall + IPS + IDS + Anti Virus + Standalone automated code vulnerability scanning, all based on pattern matching known bad signatures. That with a bit of last minute token penetration testing for the usual low hanging fruit is enough to pass ISO 27001 and PCC DSS audits so who cares if attackers are actually targeting the application layer instead of the transport layer where they are supposed to be?The solutions are complex and there's nothing management hate more than listening to a nerd talk about process when they want a tick-box outcome, preferably a very cheap one.Mine's a bitter!
